kicost.edas package¶

Submodules¶

kicost.edas.eda_altium module¶

kicost.edas.eda_altium.get_part_groups(in_file, ignore_fields, variant)[source]¶

@brief Get groups of identical parts from an XML file and return them as a dictionary. @param in_file str() with the file name. @param ignore_fields list() fields do be ignored on the read action. @param variant str() in regular expression to match with the design version of the BOM. @return dict() of the parts designed. The keys are the componentes references.

kicost.edas.eda_kicad module¶

kicost.edas.eda_kicad.get_part_groups(in_file, ignore_fields, variant)[source]¶

Get groups of identical parts from an XML file and return them as a dictionary. @param in_file str() with the file name. @param ignore_fields list() fields do be ignored on the read action. @param variant str() in regular expression to match with the design version of the BOM. @return dict() of the parts designed. The keys are the componentes references.

kicost.edas.generic_csv module¶

kicost.edas.generic_csv.get_part_groups(in_file, ignore_fields, variant)[source]¶

Get groups of identical parts from an generic CSV file and return them as a dictionary. @param in_file str() with the file name. @param ignore_fields list() fields do be ignored on the read action. @param variant str() in regular expression to match with the design version of the BOM. For now, variant`is not used on CSV read, just kept to compatibility with the other EDA submodules. @return `dict() of the parts designed. The keys are the componentes references.

kicost.edas.tools module¶

kicost.edas.tools.file_eda_match(file_name)[source]¶

@brief Verify with which EDA the file matches.

Return the EDA name with the file matches or None if not founded. @param file_name File str name. @return Name of the module corresponding to read the file or `None`to not recognized.

kicost.edas.tools.partgroup_qty(component)[source]¶

@brief Take the components grouped quantity.

Calculate the string of the quantity of the group parsing the reference (design) quantity and the sub quantity (in case that was a sub part of a manufacture/distributor code). In the case of the multifiles BOM (and future revision of the code) just use the ‘manf#_qty’ field that in group_parts() recorded the quantities used in each project.

@param components Part component dict(), format given by the EDA modules. @return Quantity of the manf# part used.

kicost.edas.tools.groups_sort(new_component_groups)[source]¶

@brief Order the groups in a alphabetical way.

Put the components groups in the spreadsheet rows in a specific order using the reference string of the components. The order is defined by BOM_ORDER. @param components Part components in a list() of dict(), format given by the EDA modules. @return Same as input.

kicost.edas.tools.order_refs(refs, collapse=True)[source]¶

@brief Collapse list of part references into a sorted, comma-separated list of hyphenated ranges. This is intended as opposite of split_refs() @param refs Designator/references list(). @return References in a organized view way.

kicost.edas.tools.subpartqty_split(components)[source]¶

@brief Split the components with subparts in different components.

Take each part and the all manufacture/distributors combination possibility to split in subpart the components part that have more than one manufacture/distributors code. For each designator… For designator with a “single subpart” check with the quantity is more than one.

@param components Part components in a list() of dict(), format given by the EDA modules. @return Same as the input.

kicost.edas.tools.group_parts(components, fields_merge)[source]¶

@brief Group common parts after preprocessing from XML or CSV files.

Group common parts looking in the existent files that could be merged by the use of fields_merge. First group all designed parts without look the manufacture/distributors codes, after see if any will be propagated (designed part with out information and same values, footprint and so on that other that have manufacture part, receive this code). Count the quantities of each part designed using the ‘manf#_qty’ field, this is important to merge subparts of different parts and parts of different BOMs (in the mode of multifiles). @param components Part components in a list() of dict(), format given by the EDA modules. @param fields_merge Data fields of the dict() variable to be merged and ignored to make the identical components group (before be scraped in the distributors web site). @return list() of dict()
